OnePieceFacts.fact: The main protagonist, Monkey D. Luffy, forms the Straw Hat Pirates, a diverse crew of individuals with unique abilities and backgrounds, each with their own dreams and goals.

The Grand Line is the most dangerous and unpredictable sea route in the One Piece world, where the majority of the story takes place. It is divided into two halves by the Red Line and contains mysterious islands, treacherous weather, and powerful enemies.

Devil Fruits are mystical fruits that grant unique superhuman abilities to those who consume them. However, they also render the consumer unable to swim, making them vulnerable to drowning. Luffy's ability to stretch his body like rubber comes from eating the Gum-Gum Fruit (Gomu Gomu no Mi).

The Yonko, also known as the Four Emperors, are the four most powerful and notorious pirate captains in the world. They exert significant influence over the New World, one of the halves of the Grand Line. They are currently Kaido, Big Mom, Blackbeard, and Shanks.

The World Government is the ruling body of the One Piece world and maintains control over the majority of the world's territories. The Marines are the military arm of the World Government, tasked with enforcing its laws and capturing pirates. The protagonist Luffy and his crew often clash with both the World Government and the Marines.

Throughout the series, there are mentions of ancient weapons, powerful artifacts with the potential to reshape the world. One such weapon is Pluton, an ancient battleship capable of mass destruction. Another is Poseidon, a person with the ability to communicate with Sea Kings.

Several characters in One Piece carry the initial "D" in their names, including Luffy (Monkey D. Luffy) and his brother, Portgas D. Ace. This initial signifies a mysterious and significant lineage that has yet to be fully explained in the series.

The Void Century is a period in the world's history that has been erased from public knowledge by the World Government. Unraveling the mysteries of this lost century is a central theme in the overarching narrative of One Piece.

Haki is a mysterious power that is found in every living being in the world of One Piece but is usually dormant. It can be awakened through training and has three main types: Observation Haki, Armament Haki, and Conqueror's Haki. Skilled users can use Haki to sense others' presence, strengthen their attacks, and even exert their willpower over others.

The Revolutionary Army is a powerful organization led by Monkey D. Dragon, who seeks to overthrow the World Government and create a world without oppression. Their activities often put them in direct conflict with the Marines and the World Government.

The balance of power in the One Piece world is maintained by the Three Great Powers: the Yonko, the Seven Warlords of the Sea (formerly known as the Shichibukai), and the Marines. These factions are considered the strongest forces in the world and their interactions shape the course of history.

Poneglyphs are ancient stone tablets scattered throughout the world that contain information about the Void Century. They are written in a language known as the Ancient Text, which very few can read. The search for Poneglyphs is a key aspect of the quest to uncover the world's secrets.

The Seven Warlords of the Sea, also known as the Shichibukai, are a group of powerful pirates who have allied themselves with the World Government in exchange for certain privileges, such as pardon for past crimes and autonomy in their territories.
The Going Merry was the first ship used by the Straw Hat Pirates. It served as their home and means of transportation for many adventures before being replaced by the Thousand Sunny.

The Will of the Void is a theory that suggests the existence of a hidden agenda behind the actions of certain powerful entities in the One Piece world, including the World Government and the Ancient Weapons.

The New World is the second half of the Grand Line and is even more dangerous and unpredictable than the first half. It is home to powerful pirate crews, dangerous sea creatures, and mysterious islands.

The Roger Pirates were a legendary pirate crew led by Gol D. Roger, also known as the Pirate King. They were the first crew to conquer the Grand Line and reach the end of the world, discovering the existence of the One Piece.

The Davy Back Fight is a pirate game introduced in the series where two crews compete against each other in various challenges, with the winning crew able to take crew members or the ship of the losing crew as prizes.

Nico Robin is a member of the Straw Hat Pirates and an archaeologist with the ability to read Poneglyphs. She seeks to uncover the true history of the world and plays a crucial role in the quest to find the One Piece.

Franky is the shipwright of the Straw Hat Pirates and the creator of their second ship, the Thousand Sunny. He is a cyborg with a passion for building ships and dreams of sailing to the end of the world.

Roronoa Zoro, the swordsman of the Straw Hat Pirates, made a promise to his childhood friend Kuina to become the world's greatest swordsman. He carries this promise with him as he continues his journey with Luffy.

Vinsmoke Sanji, the cook of the Straw Hat Pirates, dreams of finding the All Blue, a legendary sea where fish from all over the world gather. He believes that finding the All Blue will make him the greatest chef in the world.

Tony Tony Chopper, the doctor of the Straw Hat Pirates, ate the Human-Human Fruit (Hito Hito no Mi), which granted him the ability to transform into different forms, including a human-reindeer hybrid and various monster forms.

Brook is a member of the Straw Hat Pirates and a living skeleton who ate the Revive-Revive Fruit (Yomi Yomi no Mi) after dying. He was once a human pirate who died but was brought back to life by his Devil Fruit ability.

Luffy's trademark straw hat was originally owned by the pirate captain Gol D. Roger, also known as the Pirate King. Shanks, a former member of Roger's crew, passed the hat to Luffy, entrusting him with the future of piracy.

Fish-Man Island is an underwater civilization inhabited by fish-men and merfolk. It serves as a gateway between the first half and second half of the Grand Line and has a unique culture shaped by its underwater environment.

The Celestial Dragons are descendants of the founders of the World Government and are considered the highest authority in the world. They live in luxury on the Holy Land of Mariejois and have the power to do as they please, often abusing their authority.
Skypiea is a floating island located in the sky above the Grand Line. It is inhabited by a civilization of people called the Skypieans and is ruled by the god-like figure known as Eneru.
Dr. Vegapunk is a brilliant scientist known for his groundbreaking research on Devil Fruits, cyborgs, and other advanced technologies. His work has had a profound impact on the world of One Piece.

Wano Country is a closed-off nation located in the New World. It is known for its isolationist policies and traditional samurai culture. The Straw Hat Pirates journey to Wano to help overthrow the tyrannical ruler Kaido.

Oars was a giant who lived over 500 years ago and is considered a legendary figure among his kind. His will to see his friends and family again lives on in his descendants, particularly the giant pirate warrior, Oars Jr.

After the events of Dressrosa, Luffy gains a fleet of ships and allies known as the Straw Hat Grand Fleet. These allies pledge their loyalty to Luffy and his crew, expanding their influence and strength in the New World.
